Ask HN: Why don't we have something like Syncthing for APIs?
text:
Syncthing can sync files on devices that are behind NAT using public servers, which is a really useful feature. If we could implement something similar for APIs, it would allow devices to communicate with a common backend without handing data out to third parties.

I think this could be a really useful as it will let users maintain control over their data while still allowing them to use the service. What do you think?

title: Ask HN: Serverless SQLite or Closest DX to Cloudflare D1?
text:
I want to spin up a simple api. I plan to eventually monetize it. The backend data is 1m rows with 3 columns. That will grow by about one order of magnitude.

api consumers are likely to be bursty, requesting 10s of thousands of requests.

I tried D1 but it's not quite there and I couldn't find a reliable way to import this many rows. I did like how fast it was to develop with workers.

Any recs?

Shortwave: The next generation of email designed for professionals
AI is here to help, not replace
text:
I was worried about my job but after some research I found out:

As a graphic designer, you may be wondering how AI will impact your job. While it is true that AI can assist with certain tasks, such as image recognition and simple design tasks, it is not capable of fully replacing the creativity and unique perspective that only a human designer can bring to the table.

For example, AI may be able to generate basic designs based on a set of parameters, but it cannot understand the nuances and subtleties of design that a human can. It cannot take into account the brand's personality, target audience, and design trends, or apply design principles such as balance and hierarchy.

In fact, AI can even help to free up time for designers to focus on more complex, high-level projects. So, embrace the technology and let it enhance your work, rather than replacing it. The future of design is a collaborative effort between humans and AI, and together we can create truly innovative and effective designs.
